description: Bandit - a Python source code security analyzer
usage: bandit [-h] [-r] [-a {file,vuln}] [-n CONTEXT_LINES] [-c CONFIG_FILE] [-p PROFILE] [-t TESTS] [-s SKIPS] [-l | --severity-level {all,low,medium,high}] [-i | --confidence-level {all,low,medium,high}] [-f {csv,custom,html,json,screen,txt,xml,yaml}] [--msg-template MSG_TEMPLATE] [-o [OUTPUT_FILE]] [-v] [-d] [-q] [--ignore-nosec] [-x EXCLUDED_PATHS] [-b BASELINE] [--ini INI_PATH] [--exit-zero] [--version] [targets ...]

arguments.name: targets
arguments.description: source file(s) or directory(s) to be tested

options.name: --help
options.description: show this help message and exit

options.name: --recursive
options.description: find and process files in subdirectories

options.name: --aggregate
options.description: aggregate output by vulnerability (default) or by filename

options.name: --number
options.description: maximum number of code lines to output for each issue

options.name: --configfile
options.description: optional config file to use for selecting plugins and overriding defaults

options.name: --profile
options.description: profile to use (defaults to executing all tests)

options.name: --tests
options.description: comma-separated list of test IDs to run

options.name: --skip
options.description: comma-separated list of test IDs to skip

options.name: --level
options.description: report only issues of a given severity level or higher (-l for LOW, -ll for MEDIUM, -lll for HIGH)

options.name: --severity-level
options.description: report only issues of a given severity level or higher. "all" and "low" are likely to produce the same results, but it is possible for rules to be undefined which will not be listed in "low".

options.name: --confidence
options.description: report only issues of a given confidence level or higher (-i for LOW, -ii for MEDIUM, -iii for HIGH)

options.name: --confidence-level
options.description: report only issues of a given confidence level or higher. "all" and "low" are likely to produce the same results, but it is possible for rules to be undefined which will not be listed in "low".

options.name: --format
options.description: specify output format

options.name: --msg-template
options.description: specify output message template (only usable with --format custom), see CUSTOM FORMAT section for list of available values

options.name: --output
options.description: write report to filename

options.name: --verbose
options.description: output extra information like excluded and included files

options.name: --debug
options.description: turn on debug mode

options.name: --quiet
options.description: only show output in the case of an error

options.name: --ignore-nosec
options.description: do not skip lines with # nosec comments

options.name: --exclude
options.description: comma-separated list of paths (glob patterns supported) to exclude from scan (note that these are in addition to the excluded paths provided in the config file) (default: .svn,CVS,.bzr,.hg,.git,__pycache__,.tox,.eggs,*.egg)

options.name: --baseline
options.description: path of a baseline report to compare against (only JSON-formatted files are accepted)

options.name: --ini
options.description: path to a .bandit file that supplies command line arguments

options.name: --exit-zero
options.description: exit with 0, even with results found

options.name: --version
options.description: show program's version number and exit
